org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.mailbox

Class MailboxBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.mailbox.MailboxBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Runnable, Mailbox, MessageSource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ThreadBoundMailbox, UnboundMailbox

    public abstract class MailboxBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements Mailbox, MessageSource, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Base class for mailboxes.

      private Message currentMessage
      The request or signal message being processed.

      The context of this mailbox.

      Mailbox logger.
      protected java.util.Map<MailboxBase,java.util.ArrayDeque<Message>> sendBuffer
      A table of outboxes, one for each unique message destination.

           int _initialOutboxSize,
           int _initialLocalQueueSize)
        Create a mailbox.
        Parameters:
        _jaContext - The context of this mailbox.
        _initialOutboxSize - Initial size of the outbox for each unique message destination.
        _initialLocalQueueSize - The initial number of slots in the local queue.

      • hasWork

        public final boolean hasWork()
        Returns true when there is a message in the inbox that can be processed. (This method is not thread safe and must be called on the mailbox's thread.)
        Returns:
        True if there is a message in the inbox that can be processed.

      • isInboxEmpty

        public final boolean isInboxEmpty()
        Description copied from interface: Mailbox
        Returns true when there are no more messages in the inbox. This method is generally only called by a mailbox's onIdle task to determine when to return so that an incoming message can be processed.
        Specified by:
        isInboxEmpty in interface Mailbox
        Returns:
        True when the inbox is empty.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Specified by:

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setExceptionHandler

        public final ExceptionHandler setExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler _handler)
        Description copied from interface: Mailbox
        Replace the current ExceptionHandler with another.

        When an event or request message is processed by a mailbox, the current exception handler is set to null. When a request is sent by a mailbox, the current exception handler is saved in the outgoing message and restored when the response message is processed.

        Specified by:
        setExceptionHandler in interface Mailbox
        Parameters:
        _handler - The exception handler to be used now. May be null if the default exception handler is to be used.
        Returns:
        The exception handler that was previously in effect, or null if the default exception handler was in effect.

      • getExceptionHandler

        public final ExceptionHandler getExceptionHandler()
        The current exception handler.
        Returns:
        The current exception handler, or null.

                        boolean _local)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Add a message directly to the input queue of a Mailbox.
        Parameters:
        _message - A message.
        _local - True when the current thread is bound to the mailbox.

      • buffer

        public boolean buffer(Message _message,
             Mailbox _target)
        Buffers a message in the sending mailbox for sending later.
        Parameters:
        _message - Message to be buffered.
        _target - The mailbox that should eventually receive this message
        Returns:
        True if the message was buffered.

      • run

        public void run()
        Description copied from interface: Mailbox
        Processes the messages in the inbox. For a thread-bound mailbox this method must be called by the thread it is bound to, while for non-blocking and atomic mailboxes this method is called by ThreadManager.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in interface Mailbox
